name: replicapool
title: Google Compute Engine Instance Group Manager API
description: [Deprecated. Please use Instance Group Manager in Compute API] Provides groups of homogenous Compute Engine instances.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: A list of instance resources.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Type of resource.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: A token used to continue a truncated list request (output only).

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: Server defined URL for this resource (output only).

fields.name: id
fields.desc: Unique identifier for the resource; defined by the server (output only).

fields.name: instances
fields.desc:
The names of one or more instances to abandon. For example:
{ 'instances': [ 'instance-c3po', 'instance-r2d2' ] }

fields.name: instanceTemplate
fields.desc: The full URL to an Instance Template from which all new instances will be created.

schemas.name: Operation
schemas.desc: An operation resource, used to manage asynchronous API requests.

fields.name: insertTime
fields.desc: [Output Only] The time that this operation was requested, in RFC3339 text format.

fields.name: progress
fields.desc: [Output only] An optional progress indicator that ranges from 0 to 100. There is no requirement that this be linear or support any granularity of operations. This should not be used to guess at when the operation will be complete. This number should be monotonically increasing as the operation progresses.

fields.name: region
fields.desc: [Output Only] URL of the region where the operation resides. Only available when performing regional operations.

fields.name: startTime
fields.desc: [Output Only] The time that this operation was started by the server, in RFC3339 text format.

fields.name: targetLink
fields.desc: [Output only] URL of the resource the operation is mutating.

fields.name: creationTimestamp
fields.desc: [Output Only] The time that this operation was requested, in RFC3339 text format.

fields.name: httpErrorStatusCode
fields.desc: [Output only] If operation fails, the HTTP error status code returned.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: [Output only] Type of the resource.

fields.name: status
fields.desc: [Output Only] Status of the operation.

fields.name: warnings
fields.desc: [Output Only] If there are issues with this operation, a warning is returned.

fields.name: data
fields.desc: [Output only] Metadata for this warning in key:value format.

fields.name: key
fields.desc: [Output Only] Metadata key for this warning.

fields.name: value
fields.desc: [Output Only] Metadata value for this warning.

fields.name: message
fields.desc: [Output only] Optional human-readable details for this warning.

fields.name: code
fields.desc: [Output only] The warning type identifier for this warning.

fields.name: httpErrorMessage
fields.desc: [Output only] If operation fails, the HTTP error message returned.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: [Output Only] Unique identifier for the resource, generated by the server.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: [Output Only] Name of the resource.

fields.name: operationType
fields.desc: [Output only] Type of the operation. Operations include insert, update, and delete.

fields.name: user
fields.desc: [Output Only] User who requested the operation, for example: user@example.com.

fields.name: zone
fields.desc: [Output Only] URL of the zone where the operation resides. Only available when performing per-zone operations.

fields.name: clientOperationId
fields.desc: [Output only] An optional identifier specified by the client when the mutation was initiated. Must be unique for all operation resources in the project.

fields.name: endTime
fields.desc: [Output Only] The time that this operation was completed, in RFC3339 text format.

fields.name: error
fields.desc: [Output Only] If errors occurred during processing of this operation, this field will be populated.

fields.name: errors
fields.desc: [Output Only] The array of errors encountered while processing this operation.

fields.name: code
fields.desc: [Output Only] The error type identifier for this error.

fields.name: location
fields.desc: [Output Only] Indicates the field in the request which caused the error. This property is optional.

fields.name: message
fields.desc: [Output Only] An optional, human-readable error message.

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: [Output Only] Server-defined fully-qualified URL for this resource.

fields.name: statusMessage
fields.desc: [Output Only] An optional textual description of the current status of the operation.

fields.name: targetId
fields.desc: [Output Only] Unique target ID which identifies a particular incarnation of the target.

fields.name: actionType
fields.desc: The action to perform when an instance becomes unhealthy. Possible values are RECREATE or REBOOT. RECREATE replaces an unhealthy instance with a new instance that is based on the instance template for this managed instance group. REBOOT performs a soft reboot on an instance. If the instance cannot reboot, the instance performs a hard restart.

fields.name: healthCheck
fields.desc: The URL for the HealthCheck that signals autohealing.

fields.name: baseInstanceName
fields.desc: The base instance name to use for instances in this group. The value must be a valid RFC1035 name. Supported characters are lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens (-). Instances are named by appending a hyphen and a random four-character string to the base instance name.

fields.name: fingerprint
fields.desc: [Output only] Fingerprint of the instance group manager. This field is used for optimistic locking. An up-to-date fingerprint must be provided in order to modify the Instance Group Manager resource.

fields.name: instanceTemplate
fields.desc: The full URL to an instance template from which all new instances will be created.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the instance group manager. Must be 1-63 characters long and comply with RFC1035. Supported characters include lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: [Output only] The resource type. Always replicapool#instanceGroupManager.

fields.name: autoHealingPolicies
fields.desc: The autohealing policy for this managed instance group. You can specify only one value.

fields.name: currentSize
fields.desc: [Output only] The number of instances that currently exist and are a part of this group. This includes instances that are starting but are not yet RUNNING, and instances that are in the process of being deleted or abandoned.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: An optional textual description of the instance group manager.

fields.name: group
fields.desc: [Output only] The full URL of the instance group created by the manager. This group contains all of the instances being managed, and cannot contain non-managed instances.

fields.name: creationTimestamp
fields.desc: [Output only] The time the instance group manager was created, in RFC3339 text format.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: [Output only] A server-assigned unique identifier for the resource.

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: [Output only] The fully qualified URL for this resource.

fields.name: targetPools
fields.desc: The full URL of all target pools to which new instances in the group are added. Updating the target pool values does not affect existing instances.

fields.name: targetSize
fields.desc: [Output only] The number of instances that the manager is attempting to maintain. Deleting or abandoning instances affects this number, as does resizing the group.

fields.name: instances
fields.desc:
Names of instances to delete.

Example: 'instance-foo', 'instance-bar'

fields.name: instances
fields.desc:
The names of one or more instances to recreate. For example:
{ 'instances': [ 'instance-c3po', 'instance-r2d2' ] }

fields.name: fingerprint
fields.desc: The current fingerprint of the Instance Group Manager resource. If this does not match the server-side fingerprint of the resource, then the request will be rejected.

fields.name: targetPools
fields.desc: A list of fully-qualified URLs to existing Target Pool resources. New instances in the Instance Group Manager will be added to the specified target pools; existing instances are not affected.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: Unique identifier for the resource; defined by the server (output only).

fields.name: items
fields.desc: The operation resources.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Type of resource.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: A token used to continue a truncated list request (output only).

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: Server defined URL for this resource (output only).

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Retrieves the specified zone-specific operation resource.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: Name of the project scoping this request.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: Name of the zone scoping this request.

pathParams.name: operation
pathParams.desc: Name of the operation resource to return.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Retrieves the list of operation resources contained within the specified zone.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: Name of the project scoping this request.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: Name of the zone scoping this request.

optinalQueryParams.name: filter
optinalQueryParams.desc: Optional. Filter expression for filtering listed resources.

optinalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optinalQueryParams.desc: Optional. Maximum count of results to be returned. Maximum value is 500 and default value is 500.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc: Optional. Tag returned by a previous list request truncated by maxResults. Used to continue a previous list request.

methods.name: abandonInstances
methods.desc: Removes the specified instances from the managed instance group, and from any target pools of which they were members, without deleting the instances.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: The Google Developers Console project name.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The name of the zone in which the instance group manager resides.

pathParams.name: instanceGroupManager
pathParams.desc: The name of the instance group manager.

methods.name: deleteInstances
methods.desc: Deletes the specified instances. The instances are deleted, then removed from the instance group and any target pools of which they were a member. The targetSize of the instance group manager is reduced by the number of instances deleted.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: The Google Developers Console project name.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The name of the zone in which the instance group manager resides.

pathParams.name: instanceGroupManager
pathParams.desc: The name of the instance group manager.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Retrieves the list of Instance Group Manager resources contained within the specified zone.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: The Google Developers Console project name.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The name of the zone in which the instance group manager resides.

optinalQueryParams.name: filter
optinalQueryParams.desc: Optional. Filter expression for filtering listed resources.

optinalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optinalQueryParams.desc: Optional. Maximum count of results to be returned. Maximum value is 500 and default value is 500.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc: Optional. Tag returned by a previous list request truncated by maxResults. Used to continue a previous list request.

methods.name: recreateInstances
methods.desc: Recreates the specified instances. The instances are deleted, then recreated using the instance group manager's current instance template.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: The Google Developers Console project name.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The name of the zone in which the instance group manager resides.

pathParams.name: instanceGroupManager
pathParams.desc: The name of the instance group manager.

methods.name: resize
methods.desc: Resizes the managed instance group up or down. If resized up, new instances are created using the current instance template. If resized down, instances are removed in the order outlined in Resizing a managed instance group.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: The Google Developers Console project name.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The name of the zone in which the instance group manager resides.

pathParams.name: instanceGroupManager
pathParams.desc: The name of the instance group manager.

requiredQueryParams.name: size
requiredQueryParams.desc: Number of instances that should exist in this Instance Group Manager.

methods.name: setInstanceTemplate
methods.desc: Sets the instance template to use when creating new instances in this group. Existing instances are not affected.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: The Google Developers Console project name.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The name of the zone in which the instance group manager resides.

pathParams.name: instanceGroupManager
pathParams.desc: The name of the instance group manager.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Deletes the instance group manager and all instances contained within. If you'd like to delete the manager without deleting the instances, you must first abandon the instances to remove them from the group.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: The Google Developers Console project name.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The name of the zone in which the instance group manager resides.

pathParams.name: instanceGroupManager
pathParams.desc: Name of the Instance Group Manager resource to delete.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Returns the specified Instance Group Manager resource.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: The Google Developers Console project name.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The name of the zone in which the instance group manager resides.

pathParams.name: instanceGroupManager
pathParams.desc: Name of the instance resource to return.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Creates an instance group manager, as well as the instance group and the specified number of instances.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: The Google Developers Console project name.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The name of the zone in which the instance group manager resides.

requiredQueryParams.name: size
requiredQueryParams.desc: Number of instances that should exist.

methods.name: setTargetPools
methods.desc: Modifies the target pools to which all new instances in this group are assigned. Existing instances in the group are not affected.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: The Google Developers Console project name.

pathParams.name: zone
pathParams.desc: The name of the zone in which the instance group manager resides.

pathParams.name: instanceGroupManager
pathParams.desc: The name of the instance group manager.
